main.name: Nathan Brown
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: Use this bio section as your way of describing yourself and saying what you do, what technologies you like to use or feel most comfortable with, describing your personality, or whatever else you feel like throwing in.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Took a deep dive in languages and technologies such as: Java, C++, C#, MySQL, Swift, Android Studio, wireframing, data structures, GUI and API development and more.

work.title: Lead Developer
work.description: Designed and developed a new, fully responsive website in React that conveys a clearer message and has a client dashboard for uploading and managing geofences and ad promotions. Served as technical Product Owner.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Coded in Java, JavaScript (Node/Express.js), C#, and python to build various internal and client projects ranging from task/time management to automotive logistics applications.

work.title: Senior Network Operations
work.description: Provided the highest level of support for more than 2400 hotels and airports across the United States. (Marriott, IHG, Choice, Hyatt, PDK, ect.)

projects.title: GigaLoan
projects.category: Worked as part of a team to develop an Android, iOS, and Javascript Web Application. GigaLoan is used by students to find and accept odd jobs in their area. Payment upon completion of a task would go directly to the student’s education loans.

projects.title: Node.js Weather Bot
projects.category: Created a Node.js program that used Facebook’s messenger API to send information to users requesting data such as weather. Integrated the Node.js client with Wit AI in order to understand sentence structure and type of request. Currently, the bot provides up to date weather using several weather API calls.
